Build date: 31/03/06
OS: RHEL 4.0

Description:

When selecting the "Select Data" tab in the "Edit Chart" window (double click on the Chart created in the attached "test.rptdesign" to open the "Edit Chart" window), an error occurs and the view is disabled, however when switching to another tab (as "Format Chart"), and returning back to the "Select Chart" tab it opens without generating problems.


Steps to recreate the problem:

1)Import the attached "test.rptdesign" to any Report project
2)Double click on the Chart created in the "test.rptdesign" report. In the edit chart window, select the "Select Data" tab.

Expected output:

The "Select data" tab should open without any problems.

Actual output:

The "Select data" tab doesn't open, and an error occurs. "BIRTFig1.jpg" shows the displayed message box, and "logfile.txt" shows the errors in the errorlog view. 

N.B: This problem occurs only on Arabic-Egypt locale, it works fine with English-US locale.

This is a data driver issue on linux as the log shows. I googled 
"java.lang.NullPointerException sun.jdbc.odbc.JdbcOdbcDriver.initialize" and 
found that this is a recurring problem on Linux when trying to use the jdbcodbc 
driver. I reassign to Data Access team to provide assistance on this issue.
Severity increased,  we are expecting a fix in this release

As commented by David, this bug exists when JdbcOdbc driver is used in Linux environment. I have changed to throw an OdaException instead of NullPointerException, because OdaException could be caught by the caller and then the caller have chance to process it. Reassign to Chart team for further enhancement if needed.
Chart didn't change anything since Exception has been caught by the error dialog to indicate what happened
